alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 04 at 4:44AM AKST until February 04 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow and periods of light freezing rain expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Ice accumulations less than one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Juneau. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Wet snow may be difficult to manage. Freezing rain will cover exposed surfaces with a coating of ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and freezing rain are expected to continue through Friday morning north of Lemon Creek. Downtown and Douglas have warmed above freezing and are seeing a mix of rain and snow. The airport will likely transition to rain before the Mendenhall Valley and further out the road. Confidence is low regarding the exact timing of the transition to rain and the freezing rain potential, which could greatly affect total snowfall amounts. Areas that receive more mixed precipitation and change to rain sooner will likely have lower snowfall amounts.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
